answers.text: Africa and southwest corner of Asia

qas.question: What land bridge between Asian and Africa?
What Sea borders Egypt to the east?
What country borders Egypt to the south?

context: Egypt (i/ˈiːdʒɪpt/; Arabic: مِصر‎ Miṣr, Egyptian Arabic: مَصر Maṣr, Coptic: Ⲭⲏⲙⲓ Khemi), officially the Arab Republic of Egypt, is a transcontinental country spanning the northeast corner of <a0_0>Africa and southwest corner of Asia<a0_0/>, via a land bridge formed by the <a1_0>Sinai Peninsula<a1_0/>. It is the world's only contiguous Eurafrasian nation. Most of Egypt's territory of <a2_0>1,010,408 square kilometres<a2_0/> (390,000 sq mi) lies within the Nile Valley. Egypt is a Mediterranean country. It is bordered by the Gaza Strip and Israel to the northeast, the Gulf of Aqaba to the east, the <a3_0>Red Sea<a3_0/> to the east and south, <a4_0>Sudan<a4_0/> to the south and Libya to the west.
